section.title: Changes to support audit logging (CC-3590)
section.p:
The following changes support the new audit logging feature:
The /var/log/serviced.access.log file, which records HTTP/S requests, is moved to /var/log/serviced/serviced.access.log. The rules governing its retention are now based on size rather than age.
The /var/log/serviced directory is the configurable default location for all audit logs. The ownership and privileges of the directory are consistent with similar directories in /var/log.
The logrotate utility runs hourly instead of daily (/etc/cron.daily/serviced is moved to /etc/cron.hourly/serviced).

section.title: Some service logs may be temporarily unavailable (CC-3733)
section.p: Resource pools with numeric names can cause Elasticsearch parsing errors in versions of before release 1.4.0. This release includes a fix for numeric names, but the errors continue for one day after an upgrade, until the correction propagates.

section.title: Actions performed in shells are not included in audit logs (CC-3764)
section.p: When you invoke serviced service shell to run a script in an application container, actions the script performs that should be included in audit logs are not included. The workaround is to use serviced service attach.
